news.title: Race to the Áras: Mary Lou McDonald promises Sinn Féin ‘game changer’ in presidential election
news.summary: Follow the latest developments in our live blog:

news.title: Dublin Airport passengers can take two litres of liquids in hand luggage and won’t need clear bags under new rules
news.summary: Passengers at Dublin Airport can keep liquids in their luggage at security from midnight tonight, thanks to new scanning technology.

news.title: Father made video call to gardaí before body of little Daniel Aruebose found in Donabate
news.summary: Gardaí held a video call with Daniel Aruebose’s father from the wasteground where his suspected remains were found as part of their efforts to pinpoint where the little boy was buried.

news.title: Sheena McGinley: Removal of Jimmy Kimmel’s show will have chilling effect on other broadcasters
news.summary: “What about Stephen and Jimmy?” This was the declaration of my child last November when she realised Donald Trump had won the White House (again).

news.title: Gaza hit by telecoms blackout as Israeli tanks advance amid intensifying invasion
news.summary: Israeli tanks were seen in two Gaza City areas that are gateways to the city centre, residents said on Thursday, while internet and phone lines were cut off across the Gaza Strip, a sign that ground operations were likely to escalate imminently.

news.title: Conor McGregor seeks Supreme Court appeal of Nikita Hand civil rape case
news.summary: Mixed martial arts fighter Conor McGregor and his friend James Lawrence are seeking to further appeal the outcome of the Nikita Hand civil rape case to the Supreme Court.

news.title: ‘I’ve been rejected for a US visa four times’ – the trials of travelling from Ireland with a ‘bad passport’
news.summary: I’ve been rejected for a US visa four times.

news.title: Colin Farrell leaves fans in hysterics with accidental f-bomb on live TV, while eating a Tayto sandwich
news.summary: Colin Farrell was left red-faced after he accidentally swore on live TV, much to the amusement of the Irish actor’s fans.

news.title: Eilis O’Hanlon: ‘The best thing about the next President, whoever it may be, is that they won’t be treated by the media as some living saint’
news.summary: No one in their right mind ever turned on  Nationwide  (RTÉ One, Monday, 7pm) in the expectation of seeing some hard-hitting, cutting-edge investigative reporting.

news.title: Restaurant review: ‘This well-known cafe has navigated a recession and a pandemic – that’s down to good staff, good value and good ingredients’
news.summary: Whether longevity in a restaurant is something to be prized or feared is one of those perennial questions. If a place has been around for ever, does that mean it’s likely to be going through the motions and inclined to be stale? Or is it simply proof that it's good at what it does, that there’�s no need to fix what ain’t broken?
